--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Philip Tucker" <tucker0171@y...> wrote:
> >Yes, but visualization can be made through ordering of neurons by
their layers. Firstly we draw
> >neurons with "pure" 1-st level (all connections to the input one).
Then (a bit further from inputs) only
> >those neurons that have connections to the 0 and 1 layer only and
so on.
> >
> >And what was your method?
> 
> The same, except we start at the output nodes and move backward.  
> The issue is that nodes are going to be placed in the layer 
> corresponding to their shortest distance to the input (or output) 
> layer.  So, a node with 1000 paths to the input layer that are 4 
> connections long and 1 path that's 1 connection long will wind up
in 
> the first hidden layer when it would more logically be in the 4th.

Have you tried placing them in in the layer of their average distance
from the input?

ken
